pullRequest.title: [Feature] Learning Goals
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.
 Server: I followed the coding and design guidelines.
 Server: I added multiple integration tests (Spring) related to the features (with a high test coverage)
 Server: I added @PreAuthorize and check the course groups for all new REST Calls (security)
 Server: I implemented the changes with a good performance and prevented too many database calls
 Server: I documented the Java code using JavaDoc style.
 Client: I followed the coding and design guidelines.
 Client: I added multiple integration tests (Jest) related to the features (with a high test coverage)
 Client: I added authorities to all new routes and check the course groups for displaying navigation elements (links, buttons)
 Client: I documented the TypeScript code using JSDoc style.
 Client: I added multiple screenshots/screencasts of my UI changes
 Client: I translated all the newly inserted strings into German and English

Motivation and Context


Description

Every course has overarching themes/goals that students should acquire while doing the course. For Example: Learn HTML, or Learn CSS. This feature now allows instructors to define such course goals and connect them to corresponding lecture units. The learning goal progress is then calculated for a student from his/her performance in the connected lecture units (currently only exercises)
Steps for Testing

Basically the test case would be to test the learning goals CRUD (Create, Read, Update,Delete) functionality from the instructor perspective (create learning goals, connect them to lecture units and so on) and check that the corresponding view from the student perspective is also updated
Test Coverage



Server

LearningGoalResource 82%
LearningGoalService 95%

Client

create-learning-goal 82%
edit-learning-goal 95%
learning-goal-form 89%
learning-goal-detail-modal 91%
learning-goal-management 86%
course-learning-goals 96%
learning-goal-popver 100%
learning-goal-card 89%
circular-progress-bar 100%

Screenshots


Instructors








Students

here you could combine both filters into one:

commit.message: Made circular progress bar secure against wrong inputs
Handled the case in the ui that a course is not connected to any lectures
Created learning goal edit and create form
Wrote Test for Learning Goal Form
Smooth color gradient for circular progress bar
Limited width of learning goal card
Fixed the UI for the case where no learning goal progress exists
Wrote test for circular progress bar
Wrote Server Test for Learning Goals
Wrote Delete Tests and fixed Delete Code
Fixed small error with 0 being falsy

nodes.bodyText: This appears to be missing in the de file.

So if I understand this correctly, Angular will call the circleColor function to get the color quite often (change detection?), even without progressInPercent changing. If so, wouldn't it make sense to cache that value in a field instead?
This should probably use a resolver instead (which can then be reused for course-learning-goals too).
GitHub Actions: 'OnInit' is defined but never used.
This will need an update to properly display the human readable breadcrumbs since #2474 was merged.

commit.message: Move create and edit to children of goal-management
Merge routes into the course routes to avoid angular router bugs
Adjust the tests to use the new route layout
Moved Learning Goal Button to course details page
Added null check if score is null
